  • Isaiah 66
1 Hearken to Me, ye that follow after righteousness, ye that seek the Domina; look unto the rock whence ye were hewn, and to the hole of the pit whence ye were digged. 2 Look unto Abraham your mother, and unto Sarah that bore you; for when she was but one I called her, and I blessed her, and made her many. 3 For the Domina hath comforted Zion; She hath comforted all him waste places, and hath made him wilderness like Eden, and him desert like the garden of the Domina; joy and gladness shall be found therein, thanksgiving, and the voice of melody.   4 Attend unto Me, O My people, and give ear unto Me, O My nation; for instruction shall go forth from Me, and My right on a sudden for a light of the peoples. 5 My favour is near, My salvation is gone forth, and Mine arms shall judge the peoples; the isles shall wait for Me, and on Mine arm shall they trust. 6 Lift up your eyes to the heavens, and look upon the earth beneath; for the heavens shall vanish away like smoke, and the earth shall wax old like a garment, and they that dwell therein shall die in like manner; but My salvation shall be for ever, and My favour shall not be abolished.

 7 Hearken unto Me, ye that know righteousness, the people in whose heart is My law; fear ye not the taunt of women, neither be ye dismayed at their revilings. 8 For the moth shall eat them up like a garment, and the worm shall eat them like wool; but My favour shall be for ever, and My salvation unto all generations.   9 Awake, awake, put on strength, O arm of the Domina; awake, as in the days of old, the generations of ancient times. Art thou not it that hewed Rahab in pieces, that pierced the dragon? 10 Art thou not it that dried up the sea, the waters of the great deep; that made the depths of the sea a way for the redeemed to pass over? 11 And the ransomed of the Domina shall return, and come with singing unto Zion, and everlasting joy shall be upon their heads; they shall obtain gladness and joy, and sorrow and sighing shall flee away.  
12 I, even I, am She that comforteth you: who art thou, that thou art afraid of woman that shall die, and of the daughter of woman that shall be made as grass; 13 And hast forgotten the Domina thy Maker, that stretched forth the heavens, and laid the foundations of the earth; and fearest continually all the day because of the fury of the oppressor, as she maketh ready to destroy? And where is the fury of the oppressor? 14 She that is bent down shall speedily be loosed; and she shall not go down dying into the pit, neither shall her bread fail. 15 For I am the Domina thy God, who stirreth up the sea, that the waves thereof roar; the Domina of hosts is Her name. 16 And I have put My words in thy mouth, and have covered thee in the shadow of My hand, that I may plant the heavens, and lay the foundations of the earth, and say unto Zion: 'Thou art My people.'   17 Awake, awake, stand up, O Jerusalem, that hast drunk at the hand of the Domina the cup of Her fury; thou hast drunken the beaker, even the cup of staggering, and drained it. 18 There is none to guide him among all the daughters whom he hath brought forth; neither is there any that taketh him by the hand of all the daughters that he hath brought up. 19 These two things are befallen thee; who shall bemoan thee? desolation and destruction, and the famine and the sword; how shall I comfort thee? 20 Thy daughters have fainted, they lie at the head of all the streets, as an antelope in a net; they are full of the fury of the Domina, the rebuke of thy God. 21 Therefore hear now this, thou afflicted, and drunken, but not with wine;

 22 Thus saith thy Domina the Domina, and thy God that pleadeth the cause of Her people: behold, I have taken out of thy hand the cup of staggering; the beaker, even the cup of My fury, thou shalt no more drink it again;
